urls.title: Finding sustainable locations for growing rainbow trout in the Baltic Sea | CMEMS
urls.description: Almost 95 per cent of the fish farmed for food in Finland is rainbow trout. The Natural Resource Institute Finland (Luke)¬† has used Copernicus Marine Data to build an ecosystem approach for aquaculture. Nutrient discharge from fish farming may cause local eutrophication. Based on a finnish national spatial planning for aquaculture, the farming of food fish is directed towards suitable water areas that take account of the environment and other users like summer cottage-based activities.
